title: Benji confronted over ‘lazy’ Milford claims
text:
Wayne Bennett confronts Benji Marshall over ‘lazy’ Anthony Milford claims on NRL360 March 23, 2017 12:31pm Source: FOX SPORTS WAYNE Bennett has revealed he confronted Benji Marshall on Thursday morning over claims first aired on NRL360 that the veteran playmaker branded his teammate Anthony Milford a lazy trainer. 
The Brisbane mentor fronted the media at an explosive press conference, speaking out against claims NRL360 co-host and Daily Telegraph journalist Paul Kent made on Milford’s attitude towards training. 
Kent claimed the off-contract no.6 is “a guy that goes in (to training), gets down on the machines in the gym and if you’ve got to do 10 and nobody’s watching, he pumps out eight because nobody’s watching.” 
He also took aim at Milford’s skin folds before adding: “Benji Marshall’s horrified by it. It’s not good enough.” 
Marshall, who was thrown a $100,000 lifeline by the Broncos after departing the Dragons, was a regular panellist on the television program last year. Wayne Bennett at training. Source: News Corp Australia 
His link to the show only fuelled speculation he leaked in-house information to a journalist about Milford. 
While Bennett didn’t refer to Marshall by name, he revealed there was a confrontation prior to training today. 
“I confronted the player this morning who allegedly made a comment (about Milford), and he never made that comment and he never made the comment. The journalist made it up,” Bennett said.

“To be quite candid with you, I’m kind of over a lot of things and a lot of issues that are happening right now in our game. 
“On the Anthony Milford issue this morning, I needed to talk to that player. I had to make sure that comment hadn’t been made or why it was made. 
“But the player assured me, and I believe that player, that he never spoke to the journalist and he never gave him that information.” 
Backing Milford’s work ethic, the coach stressed there is no issue with the 22-year-old. Milf, Broncos close to deal 0:51 
Having claimed Kent’s comments were nothing but farcical, Bennett then took aim at the media as a whole. 
“Anthony has a good work ethic,” Bennett said. 
“We don’t have a problem with Anthony Milford in any form, shape or manner. 
“We’ve lost the change room, I’ve lost my aura ... it’s just all rubbish you guys are making up and it’s getting ridiculous. It’s offensive actually in the end. 
“There are things that happen in a workplace, there is in-house stuff that should stay in there and we are no different at the Broncos. We have that right to have that. 
“Anthony doesn’t have a poor work ethic. He trains. You guys are here, you see him out here with everybody, he doesn’t take shortcuts, he doesn’t miss anything. 
“I’m quick to jump on this because I’m over where we are going with all this stuff.” 
This is the latest in a string of dramas out of Red Hill regarding leaked information. 
Only last year Josh McGuire was accused of leaking team information to the media which resulted in a picture of a rat stuck to his locker.
